TypeSignature.Value: public class TtsSpan : Java.Lang.Object, Android.Text.IParcelableSpan, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TtsSpan extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Android.Text.IParcelableSpan, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A span that supplies additional meta-data for the associated text intended for text-to-speech engines.

remarks.para:
A span that supplies additional meta-data for the associated text intended for text-to-speech engines. If the text is being processed by a text-to-speech engine, the engine may use the data in this span in addition to or instead of its associated text.
Each instance of a TtsSpan has a type, for example or . And a list of arguments, provided as key-value pairs in a bundle.
The inner classes are there for convenience and provide builders for each TtsSpan type.

Docs.summary: String argument supplying animacy information.

remarks.para: String argument supplying animacy information. Can be or

Docs.summary: String argument supplying case information.

remarks.para: String argument supplying case information. Can be any of , , , , , , and

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the country code of a telephone number.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the country code of a telephone number. Can be a string of digits optionally prefixed with a "+". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the currency.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the currency. Should be a ISO4217 currency code, e.g. "USD". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the day of the month of a date.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the day of the month of a date. The value should be provided as an integer in the range from 1 up to and including 31. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the denominator of a fraction.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the denominator of a fraction. The value can be a string of digits of any size optionally prefixed with a + or -. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify a string of digits.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify a string of digits. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the domain part of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the domain part of a URI. For example "source.android.com". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the extension part of a telephone number.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the extension part of a telephone number. Can be a string of digits. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the fractional part of a decimal.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the fractional part of a decimal. The value can be a string of digits of any size. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the fragment id of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the fragment id of a URI. Should be specified as a string. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: String argument supplying gender information.

remarks.para: String argument supplying gender information. Can be any of , and .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the hours of a time.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the hours of a time. The hours should be provided as an integer in the range from 0 up to and including 24. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the integer part of a decimal or fraction.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the integer part of a decimal or fraction. The value can be a string of digits of any size optionally prefixed with a - or +. Can be used with and .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the minutes of a time.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the minutes of a time. The hours should be provided as an integer in the range from 0 up to and including 59. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the month of a date.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the month of a date. The value should be provided as an integer and can be any of , , , , , , , , , , and . Can be used with .

Docs.summary: String argument supplying multiplicity information.

remarks.para: String argument supplying multiplicity information. Can be any of , and

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify a whole number.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify a whole number. The value can be a string of digits of any size optionally prefixed with a - or +. Can be used with and .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the main number part of a telephone number.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the main number part of a telephone number. Can be a string of digits where the different parts of the telephone number can be separated with a space, '-', '/' or '.'. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the numerator of a fraction.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the numerator of a fraction. The value can be a string of digits of any size optionally prefixed with a - or +. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the password part of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the password part of a URI. Should be set as a string. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the path part of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the path part of a URI. For example "source/index.html". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the port number of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the port number of a URI. Should be specified as an integer. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the protocol of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the protocol of a URI. Examples are "http" and "ftp". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to choose the suffix (thousand, million, etc) that is used to pronounce large amounts of money.

remarks.para: Argument used to choose the suffix (thousand, million, etc) that is used to pronounce large amounts of money. For example it can be used to disambiguate between "two thousand five hundred dollars" and "two point five thousand dollars". If implemented, engines should support at least "1000", "1000000", "1000000000" and "1000000000000". Example: if the argument is "10", the argument is "4", the argument is "1000" and the argument is "usd", the TTS engine may pronounce the span as "ten point four thousand dollars". With the same example but with the quantity set as "1000000" the TTS engine may pronounce the span as "ten point four million dollars". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the query string of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the query string of a URI. For example "arg=value&argtwo=value". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Returns a bundle of the arguments set.

remarks.para: Returns a bundle of the arguments set.

Docs.summary: String supplying the text to be synthesized.

remarks.para: String supplying the text to be synthesized. The synthesizer is free to decide how to interpret the text. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the unit of a measure.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the unit of a measure. The unit should always be specified in English singular form. Prefixes may be used. Engines will do their best to pronounce them correctly in the language used. Engines are expected to at least support the most common ones like "meter", "second", "degree celsius" and "degree fahrenheit" with some common prefixes like "milli" and "kilo". Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the username part of a URI.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the username part of a URI. Should be set as a string. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify a string where the characters are read verbatim, except whitespace.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify a string where the characters are read verbatim, except whitespace. Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the weekday of a date.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the weekday of a date. The value should be provided as an integer and can be any of , , , , , and . Can be used with .

Docs.summary: Argument used to specify the year of a date.

remarks.para: Argument used to specify the year of a date. The value should be provided as a positive integer. Can be used with .

Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Returns the type.

remarks.para: Returns the type.

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a cardinal.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a cardinal. Must include the number to be synthesized with . Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a date.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a date. At least one of the arguments and has to be provided. The argument is optional if is set. The argument is optional if is set. Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a decimal number.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a decimal number. Must include the number to be synthesized with and . Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a series of digits that have to be read sequentially.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a series of digits that have to be read sequentially. The digits can be set with . Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a URI (can be used for URLs and email addresses).

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a URI (can be used for URLs and email addresses). The full schema for URLs, which email addresses can effectively be seen as a subset of, is: protocol://username:password@domain:port/path?query_string#fragment_id Hence populating just username and domain will read as an email address. All arguments are optional, but at least one has to be provided: , , , , , , and . Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a fractional number.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a fractional number. Must include the number to be synthesized with and . is optional Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a measure, consisting of a number and a unit.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a measure, consisting of a number and a unit. The number can be a cardinal, decimal or a fraction. Set the number with the same arguments as , or . The unit can be specified with . Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is an amount of money.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is an amount of money. Set the amount with the same arguments as . is used to set the currency. is optional. Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is an ordinal.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is an ordinal. Must include the number to be synthesized with . Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a telephone number.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a telephone number. The argument is required. and are optional. Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: This span type can be used to add morphosyntactic features to the text it spans over, or synthesize a something else than the spanned text.

remarks.para: This span type can be used to add morphosyntactic features to the text it spans over, or synthesize a something else than the spanned text. Use the argument to set a different text. Accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a time, consisting of a number of hours and minutes, specified with and .

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a time, consisting of a number of hours and minutes, specified with and . Also accepts the arguments , , and .

Docs.summary: The text associated with this span is a series of characters that have to be read verbatim.

remarks.para: The text associated with this span is a series of characters that have to be read verbatim. The engine will attempt to ready out any character like punctuation but excluding whitespace. is required. Also accepts the arguments , , and .
